document.docAuthor: Jung, Tae Won & Yoon, Seong Myeong
document.masterDocTitle: New records of Nuuanuidae (Crustacea: Amphipoda: Senticaudata) from Korean waters, with descriptions of one new genus and two new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New records of Nuuanuidae (Crustacea: Amphipoda: Senticaudata) from Korean waters, with descriptions of one new genus and two new species

mods:name.mods:affiliation: National Marine Biodiversity Institute of Korea, Seocheon, Korea;
Department of Biology, Chosun University, Gwangju, Korea

bibRefCitation.author: Barnard JL
bibRefCitation.refString: Barnard JL. 1970. Sublittoral Gammaridea (Amphipoda) of the Hawaiian Islands. Smithson Contr Zool. 34: 1 - 286.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Lowry and Watson (2002) revised the genus level of ‘ gammarellid group ’ and then suggested the hypothesis of phylogenetic relationship between the species included in
Nuuanu
and
Gammarella
. In this previous report,
Nuuanu
was discriminated from
Gammarella
by several plesiomorphies, such as the absence of well-developed dorsal keel on urosomite, the poorly developed eyes and the small body size ( Lowry and Watson 2002 ). Later, Lowry and Watson ’ s ‘ gammarellid group ’ was established as the Nuuanuidae by Lowry and Myers (2013) , but the perspective of classification between
Nuuanu
and
Gammarella
is still valid.

paragraph.emphasis: Key to known species of the genus Nuuanu
